          1
          
                  def update_counter(difference, reflection = reflection())
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          1
          
                    update_counter_in_database(difference, reflection)
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          1
          
                    update_counter_in_memory(difference, reflection)
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                  end
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
          
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          1
          
                  def update_counter_in_database(difference, reflection = reflection())
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          1
          
                    if has_cached_counter?(reflection)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                      counter = cached_counter_attribute_name(reflection)
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                      owner.class.update_counters(owner.id, counter => difference)
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                    end
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                  end
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
          
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          1
          
                  def update_counter_in_memory(difference, reflection = reflection())
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          3
          
                    if has_cached_counter?(reflection)
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                      counter = cached_counter_attribute_name(reflection)
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                      owner[counter] += difference
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                      owner.send(:clear_attribute_changes, counter) # eww
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                    end
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                  end
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
          
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                  # This shit is nasty. We need to avoid the following situation:
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                  #
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                  #   * An associated record is deleted via record.destroy
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                  #   * Hence the callbacks run, and they find a belongs_to on the record with a
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                  #     :counter_cache options which points back at our owner. So they update the
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                  #     counter cache.
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                  #   * In which case, we must make sure to *not* update the counter cache, or else
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                  #     it will be decremented twice.
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                  #
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                  # Hence this method.
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          1
          
                  def inverse_updates_counter_cache?(reflection = reflection())
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                    counter_name = cached_counter_attribute_name(reflection)
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                    inverse_updates_counter_named?(counter_name, reflection)
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                  end
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
          
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          1
          
                  def inverse_updates_counter_named?(counter_name, reflection = reflection())
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                    reflection.klass._reflections.values.any? { |inverse_reflection|
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                      inverse_reflection.belongs_to? &&
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                      inverse_reflection.counter_cache_column == counter_name
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                    }
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                  end
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
          
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          1
          
                  def delete_count(method, scope)
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          1
          
                    if method == :delete_all
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          1
          
                      scope.delete_all
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                    else
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                      scope.update_all(reflection.foreign_key => nil)
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                    end
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                  end
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          1
          
                  def delete_or_nullify_all_records(method)
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          1
          
                    count = delete_count(method, self.scope)
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          1
          
                    update_counter(-count)
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                  end
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
          
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                  # Deletes the records according to the <tt>:dependent</tt> option.
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          1
          
                  def delete_records(records, method)
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                    if method == :destroy
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                      records.each(&:destroy!)
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                      update_counter(-records.length) unless inverse_updates_counter_cache?
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                    else
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                      scope = self.scope.where(reflection.klass.primary_key => records)
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                      update_counter(-delete_count(method, scope))
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                    end
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                  end
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
          
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          1
          
                  def foreign_key_present?
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          1
          
                    if reflection.klass.primary_key
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          1
          
                      owner.attribute_present?(reflection.association_primary_key)
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                    else
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                      false
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                    end
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                  end
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
          
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          1
          
                  def concat_records(records, *)
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          2
          
                    update_counter_if_success(super, records.length)
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                  end

      168.

      171.

    178.

              class HasManyThroughAssociation < HasManyAssociation #:nodoc:

                def initialize(owner, reflection)

                  super

      15.

      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
                # Returns the size of the collection by executing a SELECT COUNT(*) query
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                # if the collection hasn't been loaded, and by calling collection.size if
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                # it has. If the collection will likely have a size greater than zero,
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                # and if fetching the collection will be needed afterwards, one less
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                # SELECT query will be generated by using #length instead.
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          1
          
                def size
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                  if has_cached_counter?
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                    owner._read_attribute cached_counter_attribute_name(reflection)
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                  elsif loaded?
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
                    target.size
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
                  else
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                    super
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                  end

                def concat(*records)

      33.

                      raise_on_type_mismatch!(record)

    35. 
          
          
                    end

                  end
        
      37.

                end
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          
        
      41.

          1
          
                def concat_records(records)
        
      42.

          2
          
                  ensure_not_nested
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
          
        
      44.

          2
          
                  records = super(records, true)
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
          
        
      46.

          2
          
                  if owner.new_record? && records
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          1
          
                    records.flatten.each do |record|
        
      48.

      50.

                  records

                def insert_record(record, validate = true, raise = false)
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          2
          
                  ensure_not_nested
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
          
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          2
          
                  if record.new_record?
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                    if raise
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                      record.save!(:validate => validate)
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                    else
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                      return unless record.save(:validate => validate)
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                    end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                  end
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
          
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          2
          
                  save_through_record(record)
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          2
          
                  if has_cached_counter? && !through_reflection_updates_counter_cache?
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                    ActiveSupport::Deprecation.warn(<<-MSG.squish)
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                      Automatic updating of counter caches on through associations has been
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                      deprecated, and will be removed in Rails 5. Instead, please set the
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                      appropriate `counter_cache` options on the `has_many` and `belongs_to`
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                      for your associations to #{through_reflection.name}.
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                    MSG
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
          
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                    update_counter_in_database(1)
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                  end
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          2
          
                  record
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                end
        
      79.

      80.

                  def through_association
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          8
          
                    @through_association ||= owner.association(through_reflection.name)
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                  end
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
          
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                  # The through record (built with build_record) is temporarily cached
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                  # so that it may be reused if insert_record is subsequently called.
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                  #
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                  # However, after insert_record has been called, the cache is cleared in
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                  # order to allow multiple instances of the same record in an association.
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          1
          
                  def build_through_record(record)
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          3
          
                    @through_records[record.object_id] ||= begin
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          2
          
                      ensure_mutable
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
          
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          2
          
                      through_record = through_association.build(*options_for_through_record)
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          2
          
                      through_record.send("#{source_reflection.name}=", record)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          2
          
                      through_record
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                    end
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                  end
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
          
        
      101. 
      
        
    101.

      103.

      104.

                  def through_scope_attributes

      107.

      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                              through_association.reflection.klass.inheritance_column)
        
      109.

      110.

      113.

      114. 
      
        
    114.

      115.

      116.

      117.

                  def build_record(attributes)
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                    ensure_not_nested
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
          
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                    record = super(attributes)
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
          
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                    inverse = source_reflection.inverse_of
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                    if inverse
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                      if inverse.collection?
        
      125.

      126. 
      
        
    126.

      131. 
      
        
    131.

                  def target_reflection_has_associated_record?

          1

      137.

                  def update_through_counter?(method)
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                    case method
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                    when :destroy
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                      !inverse_updates_counter_cache?(through_reflection)
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                    when :nullify
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                      false
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                    else
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                      true
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                    end
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                  end
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
          
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          1
          
                  def delete_or_nullify_all_records(method)
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                    delete_records(load_target, method)
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                  end
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
          
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          1
          
                  def delete_records(records, method)
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                    ensure_not_nested
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
          
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                    scope = through_association.scope
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                    scope.where! construct_join_attributes(*records)
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
          
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                    case method
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                    when :destroy
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                      if scope.klass.primary_key
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                        count = scope.destroy_all.length
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                      else
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                        scope.each do |record|
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                          record._run_destroy_callbacks
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                        end
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
          
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                        arel = scope.arel
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
          
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                        stmt = Arel::DeleteManager.new arel.engine
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                        stmt.from scope.klass.arel_table
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                        stmt.wheres = arel.constraints
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
          
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                        count = scope.klass.connection.delete(stmt, 'SQL', scope.bind_values)
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                      end
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                    when :nullify
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                      count = scope.update_all(source_reflection.foreign_key => nil)
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                    else
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                      count = scope.delete_all
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                    end
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
          
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                    delete_through_records(records)
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
          
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                    if source_reflection.options[:counter_cache] && method != :destroy
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                      counter = source_reflection.counter_cache_column
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                      klass.decrement_counter counter, records.map(&:id)
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                    end
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
          
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                    if through_reflection.collection? && update_through_counter?(method)
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                      update_counter(-count, through_reflection)
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                    end
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
          
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
                    update_counter(-count)
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
                  end
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
          
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          1
          
                  def through_records_for(record)
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                    attributes = construct_join_attributes(record)
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                    candidates = Array.wrap(through_association.target)
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                    candidates.find_all do |c|
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                      attributes.all? do |key, value|
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
                        c.public_send(key) == value
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                      end
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                    end
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                  end
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
          
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          1
          
                  def delete_through_records(records)
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                    records.each do |record|
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                      through_records = through_records_for(record)
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
          
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                      if through_reflection.collection?
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                        through_records.each { |r| through_association.target.delete(r) }
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                      else
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                        if through_records.include?(through_association.target)
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                          through_association.target = nil
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
                        end
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
                      end
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
          
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                      @through_records.delete(record.object_id)
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                    end
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                  end
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
          
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          1
          
                  def find_target
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          1
          
                    return [] unless target_reflection_has_associated_record?
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          1
          
                    get_records
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                  end
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
          
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
                  # NOTE - not sure that we can actually cope with inverses here
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          1
          
                  def invertible_for?(record)
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          2
          
                    false
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                  end
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
          
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          1
          
                  def through_reflection_updates_counter_cache?
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                    counter_name = cached_counter_attribute_name
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
                    inverse_updates_counter_named?(counter_name, through_reflection)
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
                  end
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
              end
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
            end
        
      238.

                class Aliases # :nodoc:
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          1
          
                  def initialize(tables)
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
                    @tables = tables
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
                    @alias_cache = tables.each_with_object({}) { |table,h|
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
                      h[table.node] = table.columns.each_with_object({}) { |column,i|
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
                        i[column.name] = column.alias
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
                      }
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                    }
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
                    @name_and_alias_cache = tables.each_with_object({}) { |table,h|
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
                      h[table.node] = table.columns.map { |column|
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                        [column.name, column.alias]
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                      }
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                    }
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                  end
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          
        
      22.

          1
          
                  def columns
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                    @tables.flat_map { |t| t.column_aliases }
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                  end
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          
        
      26.

                  # An array of [column_name, alias] pairs for the table
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          1
          
                  def column_aliases(node)

                    @name_and_alias_cache[node]
        
      29.

                  end

                  def column_alias(node, column)

                  class Table < Struct.new(:node, :columns)
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          1
          
                    def table

    37. 
          
          
                      Arel::Nodes::TableAlias.new node.table, node.aliased_table_name
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                    end
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          1
          
                    def column_aliases
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                      t = table
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                      columns.map { |column| t[column.name].as Arel.sql column.alias }
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                    end
        
      44. 
      
        
    44.

                attr_reader :alias_tracker, :base_klass, :join_root
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
          
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          1
          
                def self.make_tree(associations)
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          15
          
                  hash = {}
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          15
          
                  walk_tree associations, hash
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          15
          
                  hash
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                end
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
          
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          1
          
                def self.walk_tree(associations, hash)
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          15
          
                  case associations
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                  when Symbol, String
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                    hash[associations.to_sym] ||= {}
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                  when Array
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          15
          
                    associations.each do |assoc|
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                      walk_tree assoc, hash
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                    end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                  when Hash
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                    associations.each do |k,v|
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                      cache = hash[k] ||= {}
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                      walk_tree v, cache
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                    end
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                  else
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                    raise ConfigurationError, associations.inspect
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                  end
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                # base is the base class on which operation is taking place.
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                # associations is the list of associations which are joined using hash, symbol or array.
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                # joins is the list of all string join commands and arel nodes.
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                #
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                #  Example :
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                #
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                #  class Physician < ActiveRecord::Base
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                #    has_many :appointments
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                #    has_many :patients, through: :appointments
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                #  end
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                #
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                #  If I execute `@physician.patients.to_a` then
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                #    base # => Physician
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                #    associations # => []
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                #    joins # =>  [#<Arel::Nodes::InnerJoin: ...]
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                #
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                #  However if I execute `Physician.joins(:appointments).to_a` then
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                #    base # => Physician
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                #    associations # => [:appointments]
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                #    joins # =>  []
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                #
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          1
          
                def initialize(base, associations, joins)
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          15
          
                  @alias_tracker = AliasTracker.create(base.connection, joins)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          15
          
                  @alias_tracker.aliased_table_for(base.table_name, base.table_name) # Updates the count for base.table_name to 1
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          15
          
                  tree = self.class.make_tree associations
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          15
          
                  @join_root = JoinBase.new base, build(tree, base)
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          15
          
                  @join_root.children.each { |child| construct_tables! @join_root, child }
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                end
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          1
          
                def reflections
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          7
          
                  join_root.drop(1).map!(&:reflection)
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                end
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
          
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          1
          
                def join_constraints(outer_joins)
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          8
          
                  joins = join_root.children.flat_map { |child|
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                    make_inner_joins join_root, child
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                  }
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
          
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          8
          
                  joins.concat outer_joins.flat_map { |oj|
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          6
          
                    if join_root.match? oj.join_root
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          6
          
                      walk join_root, oj.join_root
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                    else
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                      oj.join_root.children.flat_map { |child|
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                        make_outer_joins oj.join_root, child
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                      }
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                    end
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  }
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                end
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          1
          
                def aliases
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                  Aliases.new join_root.each_with_index.map { |join_part,i|
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                    columns = join_part.column_names.each_with_index.map { |column_name,j|
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                      Aliases::Column.new column_name, "t#{i}_r#{j}"
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                    }
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                    Aliases::Table.new(join_part, columns)
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                  }
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                end
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
          
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          1
          
                def instantiate(result_set, aliases)
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                  primary_key = aliases.column_alias(join_root, join_root.primary_key)
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
          
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                  seen = Hash.new { |h,parent_klass|
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                    h[parent_klass] = Hash.new { |i,parent_id|
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                      i[parent_id] = Hash.new { |j,child_klass| j[child_klass] = {} }
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                    }
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                  }
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
          
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                  model_cache = Hash.new { |h,klass| h[klass] = {} }
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                  parents = model_cache[join_root]
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                  column_aliases = aliases.column_aliases join_root
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
          
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                  message_bus = ActiveSupport::Notifications.instrumenter
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
          
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                  payload = {
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                    record_count: result_set.length,
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                    class_name: join_root.base_klass.name
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                  }
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
          
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                  message_bus.instrument('instantiation.active_record', payload) do
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                    result_set.each { |row_hash|
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                      parent = parents[row_hash[primary_key]] ||= join_root.instantiate(row_hash, column_aliases)
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                      construct(parent, join_root, row_hash, result_set, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                    }
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                  end
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
          
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                  parents.values
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                end
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
          
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          1
          
                private
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
          
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          1
          
                def make_constraints(parent, child, tables, join_type)
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                  chain         = child.reflection.chain
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                  foreign_table = parent.table
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                  foreign_klass = parent.base_klass
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                  child.join_constraints(foreign_table, foreign_klass, child, join_type, tables, child.reflection.scope_chain, chain)
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                end
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
          
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          1
          
                def make_outer_joins(parent, child)
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                  tables    = table_aliases_for(parent, child)
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                  join_type = Arel::Nodes::OuterJoin
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                  info      = make_constraints parent, child, tables, join_type
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
          
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                  [info] + child.children.flat_map { |c| make_outer_joins(child, c) }
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                end
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
          
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          1
          
                def make_inner_joins(parent, child)
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                  tables    = child.tables
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                  join_type = Arel::Nodes::InnerJoin
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                  info      = make_constraints parent, child, tables, join_type
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
          
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                  [info] + child.children.flat_map { |c| make_inner_joins(child, c) }
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                end
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
          
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          1
          
                def table_aliases_for(parent, node)
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                  node.reflection.chain.map { |reflection|
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                    alias_tracker.aliased_table_for(
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                      reflection.table_name,
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                      table_alias_for(reflection, parent, reflection != node.reflection)
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                    )
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
                  }
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
                end
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
          
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          1
          
                def construct_tables!(parent, node)
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                  node.tables = table_aliases_for(parent, node)
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                  node.children.each { |child| construct_tables! node, child }
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                end
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
          
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          1
          
                def table_alias_for(reflection, parent, join)
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                  name = "#{reflection.plural_name}_#{parent.table_name}"
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                  name << "_join" if join
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                  name
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                end
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
          
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          1
          
                def walk(left, right)
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          6
          
                  intersection, missing = right.children.map { |node1|
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
                    [left.children.find { |node2| node1.match? node2 }, node1]
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                  }.partition(&:first)
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
          
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          6
          
                  ojs = missing.flat_map { |_,n| make_outer_joins left, n }
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          6
          
                  intersection.flat_map { |l,r| walk l, r }.concat ojs
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                end
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
          
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          1
          
                def find_reflection(klass, name)
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                  klass._reflect_on_association(name) or
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                    raise ConfigurationError, "Association named '#{ name }' was not found on #{ klass.name }; perhaps you misspelled it?"
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                end
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
          
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          1
          
                def build(associations, base_klass)
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          15
          
                  associations.map do |name, right|
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                    reflection = find_reflection base_klass, name
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                    reflection.check_validity!
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                    reflection.check_eager_loadable!
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
          
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
                    if reflection.polymorphic?
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                      raise EagerLoadPolymorphicError.new(reflection)
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                    end
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
          
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
                    JoinAssociation.new reflection, build(right, reflection.klass)
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
                  end
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                end
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
          
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          1
          
                def construct(ar_parent, parent, row, rs, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                  primary_id  = ar_parent.id
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
          
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                  parent.children.each do |node|
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
                    if node.reflection.collection?
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
                      other = ar_parent.association(node.reflection.name)
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
                      other.loaded!
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                    else
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                      if ar_parent.association_cache.key?(node.reflection.name)
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                        model = ar_parent.association(node.reflection.name).target
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                        construct(model, node, row, rs, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                        next
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                      end
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                    end
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
          
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
                    key = aliases.column_alias(node, node.primary_key)
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
                    id = row[key]
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                    next if id.nil?
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
          
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
                    model = seen[parent.base_klass][primary_id][node.base_klass][id]
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
          
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                    if model
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                      construct(model, node, row, rs, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                    else
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                      model = construct_model(ar_parent, node, row, model_cache, id, aliases)
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                      seen[parent.base_klass][primary_id][node.base_klass][id] = model
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                      construct(model, node, row, rs, seen, model_cache, aliases)
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
                    end
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                  end
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                end
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
          
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          1
          
                def construct_model(record, node, row, model_cache, id, aliases)
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                  model = model_cache[node][id] ||= node.instantiate(row,
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                                                                     aliases.column_aliases(node))
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                  other = record.association(node.reflection.name)
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
          
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
                  if node.reflection.collection?
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
                    other.target.push(model)
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                  else
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                    other.target = model
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                  end
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
          
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                  other.set_inverse_instance(model)
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                  model
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                end
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
              end
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
            end
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
          end
        
      283.

    vendor/bundle/gems/activerecord-4.2.0/lib/active_record/associations/join_dependency/join_base.rb

      3.

          module ActiveRecord

          1
          
              class JoinDependency # :nodoc:
        
      6.

          1
          
                class JoinBase < JoinPart # :nodoc:
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          1
          
                  def match?(other)
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          6
          
                    return true if self == other
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          6
          
                    super && base_klass == other.base_klass
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
                  end

                  def table

    vendor/bundle/gems/activerecord-4.2.0/lib/active_record/associations/join_dependency/join_part.rb

    62.5 % covered

    32 relevant lines. 20 lines covered and 12 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          1
          
          module ActiveRecord
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          1
          
            module Associations
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          1
          
              class JoinDependency # :nodoc:
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
                # A JoinPart represents a part of a JoinDependency. It is inherited
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
                # by JoinBase and JoinAssociation. A JoinBase represents the Active Record which
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
                # everything else is being joined onto. A JoinAssociation represents an association which
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
                # is joining to the base. A JoinAssociation may result in more than one actual join
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
                # operations (for example a has_and_belongs_to_many JoinAssociation would result in
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
                # two; one for the join table and one for the target table).
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          1
          
                class JoinPart # :nodoc:
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          1
          
                  include Enumerable
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
                  # The Active Record class which this join part is associated 'about'; for a JoinBase
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
                  # this is the actual base model, for a JoinAssociation this is the target model of the
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
                  # association.
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          1
          
                  attr_reader :base_klass, :children
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
                  delegate :table_name, :column_names, :primary_key, :to => :base_klass
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
          
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          1
          
                  def initialize(base_klass, children)
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          15
          
                    @base_klass = base_klass
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          15
          
                    @children = children
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                  end
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
          
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          1
          
                  def name
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
                    reflection.name
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                  end
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          1
          
                  def match?(other)
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          6
          
                    self.class == other.class
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                  end
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
          
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          1
          
                  def each(&block)
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          7
          
                    yield self
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          7
          
                    children.each { |child| child.each(&block) }
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                  end
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
          
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                  # An Arel::Table for the active_record
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          1
          
                  def table
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                    raise NotImplementedError
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                  end
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
          
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                  # The alias for the active_record's table
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          1
          
                  def aliased_table_name
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                    raise NotImplementedError
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                  end
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
          
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          1
          
                  def extract_record(row, column_names_with_alias)
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                    # This code is performance critical as it is called per row.
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                    # see: https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/12185
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                    hash = {}
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
          
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                    index = 0
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                    length = column_names_with_alias.length
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
          
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                    while index < length
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                      column_name, alias_name = column_names_with_alias[index]
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                      hash[column_name] = row[alias_name]
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                      index += 1
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                    end
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
          
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                    hash
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                  end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          1
          
                  def instantiate(row, aliases)
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                    base_klass.instantiate(extract_record(row, aliases))
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                  end
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                end
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
              end
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
            end
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
          end
        
      72.

    vendor/bundle/gems/activerecord-4.2.0/lib/active_record/associations/preloader.rb
